meanings.definition: A person who walks or behaves in a very confident and typically arrogant or aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: The swaggerer strutted down the street, looking like they owned the place.
meanings.sent2: The party was full of swaggerers showing off their confidence on the dance floor.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to be a swaggerer, puffing out his chest and taking big steps.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, the model was known as the ultimate swaggerer on the runway.
meanings.sent5: The movie villain's character was portrayed as a swaggerer, always one step ahead of the heroes.

meanings.definition: To walk or behave in a very confident and typically arrogant or aggressive way.
meanings.sent1: She swaggered into the room, making sure all eyes were on her.
meanings.sent2: The athlete swaggered towards the finish line, celebrating his victory.
meanings.sent3: The cat swaggered around the house, acting like the king of the castle.
meanings.sent4: The politician swaggered through the crowd, shaking hands and making promises.
meanings.sent5: The CEO swaggered into the boardroom, ready to make bold decisions for the company.
